name: Edith Elkind
content: Edith Elkind | Department of Computer Science Skip to main content University of Oxford Department of Computer Science HomeAbout UsPeopleFacultyEdith ElkindEdith Elkind Edith Elkind Professor of Computing ScienceNon-Tutorial Fellow, Balliol CollegeLeaving date: 30th October 2024Themes:Artificial Intelligence and Machine LearningAlgorithms and Complexity TheoryInterestsAlgorithmic game theory, computational social choice.BiographyDr. Elkind joined the Oxford Computer Science Department in 2013. Prior to coming to Oxford she was an Assistant Professor at Nanyang Technological University (Singapore), where her research was supported by the National Research foundation (NRF) Fellowship. Dr. Elkind obtained her PhD from Princeton University in 2005, and was a postdoctoral research fellow at the University of Warwick, University of Liverpool and Hebrew University of Jerusalem, as well as a lecturer (Roberts Fellow) at University of Southampton.Selected PublicationsView AllManage publications Properties of multiwinner voting rules Edith Elkind‚ Piotr Faliszewski‚ Piotr Skowron and Arkadii Slinko In Social Choice and Welfare. 2017.
